Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2007 06:02AM HugJackie wrote: Hello, I am 28 years old and was diagnosed with breast cancer on 9/14/07.  I am scheduled for a lumpectomy on 10/19/07.  I am waiting on the results of BRCA gene testing; however, I have seen two breast surgeons who have suggested that even if the BRCA test comes back negative, there is a strong possibility that my cancer is due to a different genetic mutation since my mother was diagnosed with breast cancer at age 54 and now I have it at age 28. I am strongly considering having bilateral mastectomy since I am so young and there are so many years for a recurrence to happen.  At the same time, I am scared that I might be taking too drastic measures and taking on more risk with the bilateral mastectomy.  Obviously the pathology of the lumpectomy will influence my decision, but all signs so far point to the cancer being confined to a small lump.  I would greatly appreciate it if anyone has faced a similar decision and is willing to share how they came to their decision. Thanks, Jackie
